SRC_CARDIAC.name: Cardiac Referral (Angina/MI)
SRC_CARDIAC.clinical_info: EMERGENCY! Left shoulder 68.7% of MI. Dull, deep, pressure, squeezing. Exertion-related. Palpation does NOT reproduce

SRC_CERVICAL_C5.name: C5 Radiculopathy (Cervical)
SRC_CERVICAL_C5.clinical_info: Mimics rotator cuff! Deltoid weakness, lateral arm pain. NO shoulder tenderness with passive movement

SRC_CERVICAL_C6.name: C6 Radiculopathy (Cervical)
SRC_CERVICAL_C6.clinical_info: Most common! Biceps weakness, thumb/index numbness, lateral forearm

SRC_CERVICAL_C7.name: C7 Radiculopathy (Cervical)
SRC_CERVICAL_C7.clinical_info: Triceps weakness, middle finger numbness, posterior arm/forearm

SRC_TOS.name: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome
SRC_TOS.clinical_info: Vascular/neural compression. Arm symptoms with overhead, ulnar distribution, vascular changes

SRC_THORACIC.name: Thoracic Spine Referral
SRC_THORACIC.clinical_info: Upper back stiffness, scapular pain. Thoracic rotation limitation

SRC_VISCERAL_GALLBLADDER.name: Gallbladder Referral
SRC_VISCERAL_GALLBLADDER.clinical_info: RIGHT shoulder blade/tip. Worse after fatty foods. Colicky, RUQ pain

SRC_PANCOAST_TUMOR.name: Pancoast Tumor (Lung Apex)
SRC_PANCOAST_TUMOR.clinical_info: CANCER RED FLAG! Shoulder pain + Horner syndrome, arm weakness, weight loss

SRC_ROTATOR_CUFF_TEAR.name: Rotator Cuff Tear
SRC_ROTATOR_CUFF_TEAR.clinical_info: Weakness with specific movements. Night pain. Drop arm test. Age >40 risk

SRC_ROTATOR_CUFF_TENDINOPATHY.name: Rotator Cuff Tendinopathy
SRC_ROTATOR_CUFF_TENDINOPATHY.clinical_info: Gradual onset, overhead activities, painful arc. No significant weakness

SRC_IMPINGEMENT.name: Subacromial Impingement Syndrome
SRC_IMPINGEMENT.clinical_info: Painful arc 60-120Â°. Neer/Hawkins positive. Pain with overhead. No true weakness

SRC_FROZEN_SHOULDER.name: Frozen Shoulder (Adhesive Capsulitis)
SRC_FROZEN_SHOULDER.clinical_info: PATHOGNOMONIC: Global restriction BOTH active AND passive. ER lost first. Diabetic risk

SRC_AC_JOINT.name: AC Joint Pathology
SRC_AC_JOINT.clinical_info: Point tenderness AC joint. Cross-body adduction painful. Pain at end range flexion

SRC_LABRAL_TEAR.name: Labral Tear (SLAP/Bankart)
SRC_LABRAL_TEAR.clinical_info: Clicking, catching, instability. Overhead athletes. O'Brien's test for SLAP

SRC_BICEPS_TENDINOPATHY.name: Biceps Tendinopathy
SRC_BICEPS_TENDINOPATHY.clinical_info: Anterior shoulder pain. Bicipital groove tenderness. Speed's/Yergason's test

SRC_GH_OA.name: Glenohumeral Osteoarthritis
SRC_GH_OA.clinical_info: Gradual onset, crepitus, morning stiffness <30min. Age>50, previous injury

SRC_INSTABILITY.name: Shoulder Instability
SRC_INSTABILITY.clinical_info: History of dislocation, feeling of instability, young active patients

SRC_DISC_HERNIATION.name: Lumbar Disc Herniation/Radiculopathy
SRC_DISC_HERNIATION.clinical_info: Nerve root compression. Dermatomal pain pattern, positive SLR, neurological signs

SRC_FACET_JOINT.name: Facet Joint Pain/Syndrome
SRC_FACET_JOINT.clinical_info: Posterior element pain. Worse with extension, rotation. Referred to buttock/thigh

SRC_SPINAL_STENOSIS.name: Lumbar Spinal Stenosis
SRC_SPINAL_STENOSIS.clinical_info: Neurogenic claudication. Bilateral leg symptoms with walking, relieved by sitting/flexion

SRC_MUSCLE_STRAIN.name: Muscle Strain/Myofascial Pain
SRC_MUSCLE_STRAIN.clinical_info: Most common cause. Localized pain, muscle spasm, usually resolves in weeks

SRC_SI_JOINT.name: Sacroiliac Joint Dysfunction
SRC_SI_JOINT.clinical_info: Pain below PSIS, buttock, may refer to groin/thigh. Worse sit-stand, single leg activities

SRC_HIP_SPINE_SYNDROME.name: Hip Referral (Hip-Spine Syndrome)
SRC_HIP_SPINE_SYNDROME.clinical_info: Hip OA can present as LBP. Key: groin pain, difficulty with hip activities

SRC_SPONDYLOLISTHESIS.name: Spondylolisthesis
SRC_SPONDYLOLISTHESIS.clinical_info: Vertebral slippage. May have radiculopathy. Worse with extension, better with flexion

SRC_CAUDA_EQUINA.name: Cauda Equina Syndrome
SRC_CAUDA_EQUINA.clinical_info: SURGICAL EMERGENCY. Saddle anesthesia, bladder/bowel dysfunction, bilateral weakness

SRC_VERTEBRAL_FRACTURE.name: Vertebral Compression Fracture
SRC_VERTEBRAL_FRACTURE.clinical_info: Risk: osteoporosis, steroid use, age>70, trauma. Sudden onset, point tenderness

SRC_SPINAL_MALIGNANCY.name: Spinal Malignancy/Metastases
SRC_SPINAL_MALIGNANCY.clinical_info: Red flags: history of cancer, age>50, unexplained weight loss, night pain, no relief with rest

SRC_SPINAL_INFECTION.name: Spinal Infection (Discitis/Osteomyelitis)
SRC_SPINAL_INFECTION.clinical_info: Risk: IV drug use, recent procedure, immunosuppression. Fever, severe constant pain

SRC_AAA.name: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA)
SRC_AAA.clinical_info: EMERGENCY if rupturing. Pulsating abdominal mass, vascular risk factors

SRC_INFLAMMATORY_BACK_PAIN.name: Inflammatory Back Pain (Axial Spondyloarthropathy/AS)
SRC_INFLAMMATORY_BACK_PAIN.clinical_info: Age<45, insidious onset, >3 months, morning stiffness>30min, improves with exercise

SRC_VISCERAL_RENAL.name: Renal/Kidney Pathology
SRC_VISCERAL_RENAL.clinical_info: Flank pain, colicky, urinary symptoms. May be infection or stones

SRC_VISCERAL_GI.name: GI Pathology (Pancreatitis/Ulcer)
SRC_VISCERAL_GI.clinical_info: Epigastric pain radiating to back, GI symptoms, worse with eating

SRC_CARDIAC_NECK.name: Cardiac Referral
SRC_CARDIAC_NECK.clinical_info: MI can present with neck/jaw pain. Screen for cardiac symptoms

SRC_ATFL_INJURY.name: ATFL (Anterior Talofibular Ligament) Injury
SRC_ATFL_INJURY.clinical_info: Most common ankle ligament injury (85%). Mechanism: inversion + plantarflexion

SRC_CFL_INJURY.name: CFL (Calcaneofibular Ligament) Injury
SRC_CFL_INJURY.clinical_info: Often combined with ATFL. Mechanism: inversion + dorsiflexion

SRC_HIGH_ANKLE_SPRAIN.name: High Ankle Sprain (Syndesmosis)
SRC_HIGH_ANKLE_SPRAIN.clinical_info: Longer recovery. Mechanism: external rotation or dorsiflexion

SRC_PERONEAL_TENDON.name: Peroneal Tendon Injury/Tendinopathy
SRC_PERONEAL_TENDON.clinical_info: Pain posterior to lateral malleolus. Can be acute or chronic

SRC_LATERAL_MALLEOLUS_FRACTURE.name: Lateral Malleolus Fracture
SRC_LATERAL_MALLEOLUS_FRACTURE.clinical_info: Ottawa Ankle Rules: Bone tenderness + inability to weight bear = X-ray

SRC_MEDIAL_MALLEOLUS_FRACTURE.name: Medial Malleolus Fracture
SRC_MEDIAL_MALLEOLUS_FRACTURE.clinical_info: Ottawa Ankle Rules: Medial bone tenderness = X-ray

SRC_5TH_METATARSAL_FRACTURE.name: 5th Metatarsal Fracture (Jones/Avulsion)
SRC_5TH_METATARSAL_FRACTURE.clinical_info: Ottawa Foot Rules: Base of 5th metatarsal tenderness = X-ray

SRC_STRESS_FRACTURE.name: Stress Fracture (Fibula/Tibia/Talus/Navicular)
SRC_STRESS_FRACTURE.clinical_info: Overuse injury. Risk: recent activity increase, low BMI, female athlete triad

SRC_PTTD.name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysfunction (PTTD)
SRC_PTTD.clinical_info: Progressive flatfoot. Risk: overweight, female, 40-60 years

SRC_ANKLE_OA.name: Ankle Osteoarthritis
SRC_ANKLE_OA.clinical_info: Post-traumatic most common. Risk: previous fracture/sprain, age, weight

SRC_OCD_TALUS.name: Osteochondral Lesion of Talus (OCD)
SRC_OCD_TALUS.clinical_info: Cartilage/bone lesion. Often post-injury with persistent deep pain

SRC_ANTERIOR_IMPINGEMENT.name: Anterior Ankle Impingement
SRC_ANTERIOR_IMPINGEMENT.clinical_info: Bone spurs/soft tissue impingement. Pain with dorsiflexion, squatting

SRC_POSTERIOR_IMPINGEMENT.name: Posterior Ankle Impingement
SRC_POSTERIOR_IMPINGEMENT.clinical_info: Os trigonum or soft tissue. Pain with plantarflexion. Common in dancers/footballers

SRC_SINUS_TARSI.name: Sinus Tarsi Syndrome
SRC_SINUS_TARSI.clinical_info: Lateral hindfoot pain after sprain. Feeling of instability

SRC_GOUT.name: Gout / Crystal Arthropathy
SRC_GOUT.clinical_info: Sudden onset, severe pain, red/hot. Risk: male, diet, alcohol, kidney disease

SRC_SEPTIC_ARTHRITIS.name: Septic Arthritis
SRC_SEPTIC_ARTHRITIS.clinical_info: EMERGENCY: Joint infection. Fever + red/hot/swollen + inability to move
